replies.body: Damn, do you announce that youre gonna report someone every game? Stop using the report system as a weapon to threaten people. Like, honestly, 2 out of 3 logs you call someone a troll, and 3 out of 3 you announce youre gonna get someone banned. Chat isnt there for arguing, accusing, and threatening people.

>So i can see some things that could MAYBE get me in trouble, but i fail to see how i deserved permaban after this,

 If you received a permanent ban for this game, that means you had a history of prior punishment (which you admitted to later on in the post.) Even if that player didn't tell you to kill yourself, you still _probably_ would have received another punishment based on these lines alone:

 For pretty much the entirety of these games you're going back and forth with your teammates and asking for reports. The best course of action is to mute someone and move on, not spend all game ragging on each other. 

 You were warned multiple times that continued negativity or repeated arguments would result in further punishments and you didn't heed that advice. 

Obligatory mention: Nobody is saying that player's actions were justified, if you properly reported them they should (and will be) held accountable.

Okay, but a perma ban for telling someone you're going to report them? All i am showing is that i will seek punishment for players who deserve it and i am not afraid to announce that, granted i went about it the wrong way and arguments should definitely not happen but i would like to point out that i did mute a majority of them at one point during the game, i am sure the rioters can see that in their logs somewhere, I tried i feel like that counts for something but i still dont think that a perma ban is necessary once more after telling someone to kill themself if anything riot should at least have someone look at those games and think "hmm if we punish the guy for what he said this game after being attacked like that by 2 of his own "team mates" how could if effect him? Perhaps he is already fighting a losing mental battle and maybe punishment while at the final stage of his punishment. Maybe a small amount of leeway and see how he acts in at least 2 more games of reports and we will look into it more will determine if we will punish him for good or not" Yes by the way i do fight mental battles daily and no i cant exactly afford the help i need for it, honestly thats irrelevant at this point because it really does seem like riot dont really consider how the other person feels about their situation, i have only ever seen one person get unbanned from a permanent ban T1, even with that i am 10000% sure he said shit way worse than i did in my 3 games, i would say at least a chat restriction or just remove chat functionality period for people that are in a situation like this because a perm ban literally says "Thanks for all the time and money you spent on this account, you arent going to see it anymore or be able to show it" to be honest i would be in a much better situation if i just couldnt use chat in game at all

> Okay, but a perma ban for telling someone you're going to report them? All i am showing is that i will seek punishment for players who deserve it and i am not afraid to announce that, granted i went about it the wrong way and arguments should definitely not happen

 Riot is very open about the fact that multiple reports do not increase the likelihood of a player being punished and that asking for reports or using them as leverage will set you up for reports of your own. 

 From a logical standpoint, it also doesn't make sense for you to tell someone you're reporting them. They've already broken the rules, they're already subject to punishment. Waving their impending punishment in their face is not constructive or helpful in any way. 

> but i would like to point out that i did mute a majority of them at one point during the game... (cont.)

 There are three separate chatlogs here that all contain the same behavior. 

 Even if the situation where the player told you to kill yourself was removed, you'd still be subject to a permanent ban based on those two other games.


>if anything riot should at least have someone look at those games and think "hmm if we punish the guy for what he said this game after being attacked like that by 2 of his own "team mates" how could if effect him? Perhaps he is already fighting a losing mental battle and maybe punishment while at the final stage of his punishment. Maybe a small amount of leeway and see how he acts in at least 2 more games of reports and we will look into it more will determine if we will punish him for good or not" 

 Someone else's wrongdoing doesn't justify your own. Your logs contained rulebreaking behavior and it should have been made clear that this behavior was unacceptable given your three prior punishments. 

Your leeway was the three less severe punishments, unfortunately. 


>Yes by the way i do fight mental battles daily and no i cant exactly afford the help i need for it, honestly thats irrelevant at this point because it really does seem like riot dont really consider how the other person feels about their situation

 Your mental stability or state of mind is not Riot's responsibility. 

Please understand that I mean no ill-will when I say that, but it's not feasible for Riot to hand review every case they're sent and after a certain point the player has to take action and responsibility for their behavior. 

> i have only ever seen one person get unbanned from a permanent ban T1, even with that i am 10000% sure he said shit way worse than i did in my 3 games

Tyler1 was not unpermabanned on _any_ of his accounts, he (as a person) was un-ID banned. This means that he could not create new accounts without them being banned on sight.

 You are allowed to create a new account and continue to play on that account so long as you abide by the rules. 


>i would say at least a chat restriction or just remove chat functionality period for people that are in a situation like this because a perm ban literally says "Thanks for all the time and money you spent on this account, you arent going to see it anymore or be able to show it" to be honest i would be in a much better situation if i just couldnt use chat in game at all

 Riot has already tried exponentially increasing chat restrictions and permanent chat bans before, they both resulted in players turning to grief areas of gameplay through inting or trolling instead. 

 The ability to remove allied and enemy chat was released with Patch 9.14 on July 18th, 2019, one day before your 14-day suspension. You had full control over the chat functions when you came back to the game.

That's right. It doesn't make any sense to tell the thief you're calling the police. You just prevent them from doing it to you again with the push of a button, report it to the police, and go on with your day. You don't stand outside screaming "I'm calling the police! You hear me? The COPS! You're going downtown! It's prison for you!" for 20 minutes while everyone around you wishes they'd stayed home today.

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player):

> Do not threaten or repeatedly tell a player you will report them. Doing so can encourage players who are already negative to continue their behavior. Whether they know they are being reported or not has no bearing to whether the system will act on them. But most importantly, repeatedly threatening or arguing with a negative player can end up derailing the game for everyone else and then open yourself up to reports and possible disciplinary action as well. Avoid negative thoughts and useless chatting with poor performing teammates! Focus on victory by muting the offending player and then reporting them at the end of the game.

>Riot is the only gaming company that bans for "toxicity",

 Ubisoft bans for toxicity as well. 

Microsoft and Sony ban users on a case-by-case basis for toxic private messages.

>never heard in the last 30 years of games that I have played

 You're 30+ yet you couldn't start a response without a sarcastic remark and an attempt to insult my character by calling me 10 even though, in actuality, I'm just an adult with a different opinion?

>Of course, but does it work to effectively reduce the probability of you meeting someone mean online? Probably not.
 
 Over time, _yes_, it will reduce the level of negative players. At the very least it will discourage people from breaking the rules and will slowly reduce the rate at which they do so. 

>Does it work to ban the inters and soft inters as opposed to the "mean" people? 

 There is no "either or". Players are banned for intentional feeding _and_ toxicity, they take place on two separate ladders. One class of players is not getting prioritized above another.
